intro: Omphalotrigonotis vaginata, commonly known as the bladder bladder, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, and its leaves are pinnately divided with a distinctive bladelike shape. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, calcareous soils. It has a short flowering period, typically in late spring to early summer, and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts upon maturity.
